In his youth, before the calling of the church came upon him, he was in love with a young woman, Laleia val’Mehan. The two were deeply in love; however, she came from a more powerful and far more important family of val’Mehan’s than he did, and so they could not marry. Felician decided to set out to prove his worth to Laleia and her family, and before he left she gave to him her holy symbol as a token of her love. This holy symbol, a relic from the First Imperium, was particularly powerful and valuable.

Four years passed, and during this time the young woman’s family had grown tired of waiting, and so had found her a wealthy but uninteresting man to marry. Finally, Felician returned, and discovered that his love was married to another. He tried to return the holy symbol to her, but she told him to keep it as a memory of better times. Despite her wanting otherwise, Felician swore an oath upon Sarish that he would return the holy symbol to her one day.

103139.name: RAM!
103139.description:
User Summary

RAM! is a single-player game of ancient naval combat set during the Peloponnesian War. It was designed by Steve Estvanik. The game offers three modes of play: a training mission, scenarios, and a campaign.

The are four stand-alone scenarios dated from 413 to 429 BC: Chalcis, Naupactus, Bay of Pylos, and Erineus.

In the campaign mode you control the Athenian fleet as it proceeds through the series of scenarios. Your fleet can have up to six ships, each rated for strength, marines, rowers and fatigue. Your are given a pool of points which can be spent to increase one or more of these attributes. After each scenario, fleet building points may be awarded based on your success in the scenario. These points can then be spent to upgrade your fleet before the next scenario is played.

103140.name: Perchance to Dream
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103140.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

This adventure has two "paths" – one for lower-level PCs (APL 2 through 6) and one for higher-level PCs (APL 8 through 14). All groups will explore the first level of the Catacombs at the behest of Heru Bas, who does not know what is really going on but who fears that the increasing level of undead activity is a portent of some greater calamity yet to come. Once the PCs have explored the first level, the adventure splits into two paths, with the lower-level parties dealing with Kufti (trying to prevent his summoning of the Black Sorcerer) and higher-level parties proceeding deeper into the Catacombs to try and find and deal with the Voice of Tzizhet.

103141.name: Emergence of the Spurned
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103141.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

The Myrantians were once a powerful people, until they fell from prominence. The Forsaken Wastes are rife with their ruins and ancient sites of power. Many different groups have long been interested in these sites. Amongst these groups are the new allies of Abessios – the followers of Yig.

In one of these long-forgotten Myrantian fortresses resides a band of engineered troglodytes. Known to themselves as the Sand Apophics, these creatures were specifically designed by the ancient Ssanu for living in the desert. When the Ssethregoran Empire fell, the Sand Apophics’ creators abandoned them and left them for dead. However, they did not perish. Rather, they flourished in the desert that they were bred to survive in. For countless centuries, these creatures have lived undisturbed: nations rose and fell, and among those nations was the Myrantian Hegemony. Many years ago, the Sand Apophics discovered an ideal home among the ruins in the Forsaken Wastes, and since then they have lived in one of the most hidden of the ancient bastions of the Myrantians, a place called the Fortress of Secrets.

103142.name: CJ's Elephant Antics
103142.description:
User Summary:

In CJ's Elephant Antics, you play the role of Columbus Jumbo, and you are on a plane, on your way to a zoo. Your captors plan to make a very nice exhibit of you. But... you don't want to live in captivity! You want to be home, in Africa! You need to escape!

Suddenly, turbulence hits the plane! Your cage opens! You grab the opportunity, and a nearby umbrella and you leap off the plane!

After you land, you realize that you are... oh no... in France? That's far away from home! Your adventure begins!

CJ's Elephant Antics encompasses four levels - France, Switzerland, Egypt and Africa. Throughout these levels you need to jump, outsmart, or fight your way through obstacles who try to stop you from getting home. Each level ends in a boss fight whom you have to beat to continue. On the bright side, you have an unlimited amount of peanuts you can fire as projectiles. You also have some bombs you can use in really tough spots. Will you manage to make it home?

103143.name: Sabre Team
103143.description:
Back of Box

At 19.07 on the 5th of May 1980 John Dellow of the Metropolitan Police signed a document passing control of the Iranian Embassy siege to LT. COL H.M. Ross. He sent in three, four-man teams (Sabre Teams) of 22 S.A.S., the rest is history.

For many the S.A.S. are the black-clad rescuers of Princes Street depicted by the B.B.C. as the pictures of the last minutes of the siege were relayed live around the world.

We as mere mortals can only wonder at the exploits of this most professional and highly trained fighting force as officially it does not exist.

This simulation is based on the information that is available and is produced by people who have a great deal of admiration for those whom they will never know.

103144.description:
Kai Haferkamp's Der Räuber Hotzenplotz is another game based on the Otfried Preußler children's book of the same name.

In this game the Hotzenplotz robbers have stolen a wagon of gold, but thankfully Kasper and Seppl – characters from the story apparently – had rigged this wagon ahead of time by filling it with sand and drilling a hole in the bottom. If the players can trace this sand trail properly, they'll find and capture the robbers.

To set up the game, shuffle the eight forest chips and place them face-down in the box. Shuffle the 24 sand chips, place three of them in a row behind the wagon cart (assembled by the players or their parents), then place the remaining sand chips in the wagon.

On a turn, the active player reveals the last sand chip in the line (unless it's already face-up), then reveals the forest chip that she thinks matches the image on the sand chip. If they match, she claims the sand chip and turns the forest chip face-down again, then the next player takes his turn. If they don't match, she hides the forest chip again, then rolls the die. On a red result, the robbers advance, moving the wagon forward with another sand chip falling through the hole in the wagon and adding to the trail; on a yellow result, the robbers are resting, so the good guys luck out and don't fall further behind.

If the players reach the wagon – that is, if no sand chips lie between the players and the wagon – the robbers are captured and the players collectively win, with the one who collected the most sand chips receiving special commendation. If the last sand chip falls out of the wagon, each player takes one final turn, and if they catch the wagon they win. If not, the robbers escape and the players are run out of town as bungling galoots.

The rules include a few variants to make the game easier or more difficult based on the skill level of the players.
103144.name: Der Räuber Hotzenplotz

103145.name: Seal Team
103145.description:
Back of Box

Lock and load!

Your team jumped out of a Huey and bellied through 200 yards of mud while rounds from an AK47 shrieked overhead. Now your flanker is hit. You radio for air support and a dust-off, and suddenly the night is ablaze with tracers and the percussive shock waves of mortar fire.

Welcome to the "Forest of Assassins," Vietnam's Mekong Delta--the reptile-infested jungle that is the sanctuary of the Viet Cong and North Vietnamese Army. Welcome to SEAL TEAM, a hyper-realistic simulation of US Navy SEAL combat operations designed in conjunction with the UDT-SEAL Museum Inc.

You're the point man. You lead a crack team of combat specialists deep into enemy territory to complete high-risk missions of reconnaissance, ambush, rescue and demolitions, all experienced through the multiple views of an advanced 3-D engine. It's a nightmare.

The enemy lies in ambush, but he is your prey. Lock and load! Only you can get us out of this mess.

103146.name: Special Forces (1992)
103146.description:
Back of Box

An action-packed simulation of elite rapid-deployment combat.

At times of high political tension, secret armies such as the SAS, Spetsnaz and Delta Force form the cutting edge in today's international conflicts.

These are the special forces that have won - and lost - the most spectacular military operations, in times of peace and war.

In Special Forces, the sequel to the award winning Airborne Ranger, you take charge of a specially trained team, equipped and organized to operate secretly behind enemy lines.

Enter zones of hostility in four different climatic regions, to sabotage, assassinate or rescue, and develop the close-quarter combat skills and personal survival techniques needed to complete your mission before the enemy even knows you're there.

Under cover, outnumbered and alone.


Gather intelligence about the enemy and plan lines of attack for a wide range of terrain, climate and environments.



Control your men individually or co-ordinate the activities of the team. Create diversions, use covering fire and employ the tactics used by elite rapid-deployment forces.



Select your team by studying the specialist skills required for each of the sixteen missions.



Special Forces is an exciting combination of action, strategy, danger and suspense which will push your decision-making skills and reflexes to the limit.

103147.name: Queen's Castle
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103147.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

The PCs must determine their own reasons for being in the Altherian city of Semar. Many of them will be here to celebrate the annual ceremony commemorating the victory over the invading Ssethric horde in 1026 I.C. (those who played in either the Battle of Semar interactive or the subsequent two-round version of LA-SP2-07: The Serpentine Path). Other PCs may be traveling here to witness the festival, which is said to be spectacular, or for a variety of mercantile reasons (in other words, they just happen to be in the right place at the right time).

Either way, General Muatma Bunkakin of the Altherian Shining Patrol (who some PCs have met previously) seeks the PCs out (through an adjutant) for a mission. The PCs are needed to find out why there has been no word from several of the outlying fortified outposts along the western border with Ssethregore. With the instability that has been happening throughout the rest of Onara, many nations have pulled back their troops from the Shinning Patrol. As a result, the General is very short-staffed. He needs the PCs to go out to the fortress and find out what has happened.

103148.name: Under a Blood-Red Sky
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103148.description:
From "Adventure Summary and Background:"

The PCs begin the adventure in the Sacred Cauldron Inn, where they may have heard several disturbing rumors. While there, they are hired by the Magistrate to look into several more disappearances that have been plaguing the city. The PCs can investigate the "strange disappearances" in any order. Centurion Augustus, whom the PCs likely met during The Blood of Innocence, will be appointed to accompany the PCs after their first combat encounter.

103149.name: Tigers in the Snow
videogameversion: North American Apple II/Atari 8-bit Family edition
103149.description:
Back of Box

Through the eerie winter mist came a nightmarish rumble... Tigers in the snow!

On December 16, 1944--in the twilight of his Third Reich--Hitler played his last desperate hand and launched a massive surprise assault against the thin Allied lines in the Ardennes forest of Belgium and Luxemborg. This began the Battle of the Bulge.

The German infantry and armor units did enough damage and covered enough ground in the next three days to cause near panic among the American generals. While the Allied forces regrouped and reinforcements prepared to move in, the Germans rumbled steadily toward the Meuse River and the open ground on the other side.

However, shortages of fuel and supplies seriously impeded Hitler's advance, and his troops never reached the Meuse.

How would the Germans have fared if they had been led by a clear-thinking strategist such as yourself rather than a madman? On the other hand, would the German units have gotten as far as they did if the Allies had been under your command instead of the American generals?

Here's your chance to find out in this realistic and entertaining simulation of the Battle of the Bulge....Tigers in the Snow!

By Tactical Design Group

103151.name: Disney Princess Land of Enchantment Game
103151.description:
A delightful trip through the enchanted world of Disney Princesses. Each player chooses their very special princess pieces and guides her back to her home.

The object of the game is to move your princess from her assigned start space around the track and back home, collecting four jewel cards along the way. Movement is determined by rolling a six-sided die. Five sides are colors and represent spaces on the track. The sixth side is the Evil Queen! When the Evil Queen is rolled, the player loses a turn. To counter this, there are four helper spaces on the board: landing on one of these nets the player an extra turn.

The first player to arrive back home with their four jewel cards wins the game.

Includes a bonus checkers game with Cinderella and Aurora Dawn pieces.
For ages 3+
2-4 players

103152.name: Pocket RPG
103152.description:
Overview:

Pocket RPG blends aspects of dungeon crawling with the fast action gameplay from games like Diablo and torchlight.

Features:

Full iPad iOS Support
Random level generation.
Amazing stylized 3D environments, monsters and characters.
3 Character classes 3 different playing styles.
Dual stick for moving and attacks.
Automatic skills/stat progression based on the items your character equips.
Lots of Looting.
Swarms of creatures to take out with devastating combo moves.
Boss encounters.
Leader Boards, Achievements and Unlockables.




Source: The Game Website.

103153.description:
Time to travel the animal kingdom in Reise ins Tierreich – after all, that's what the name of the game means!

Players each start the game on a different continent with one animal card from that continent in hand. One additional card from each continent is revealed, while the remaining cards are placed in decks near their continents, with the back of each card showing the name and image of an animal while that animal's stats are hidden on the other side of the card.

On a turn, a player rolls the two number dice (with values 1-3) and moves spaces equal to one of the dice or the sum of the dice. A player can use ships or planes to move from one continent to another, with a ship moving her to an adjacent continent and a plane moving her to any continent (after first moving three spots on the runway).

The player takes an action where she ends her turn:

• Qwiz - The player rolls the size (large or small) and topic (weight, age, size, number of young) dice, then selects which of the three top animal cards for that continent best match the values rolled, such as "Which of these three lives the longest?" If correct, the player keeps the card and adds it to her hand; if not, she returns all three cards.

• Match - The player names one of the topic categories and largest or smallest, then each player reveals a card in their hands. Whichever player or players have the best showing in this challenge receive an animal card from the continent where they are currently located. The winner(s) place the winning card on the table, putting it out of play until after the next match.

• National Park - The player can swap a card in hand with any of the cards by the side of the game board. She places her card face-down in the display and adds the other card to her hand.

The player who first collects one animal card from each of the six continents while also having one animal of each of the five types (mammal, amphibian, reptile, bird, fish) wins the game. For a shorter game, the only winning requirement is to have one card from each continent.
103153.name: Reise ins Tierreich

103154.name: Gears
103154.description:
Gears is a physics-based 3D ball-roller set in a whimsical and fantastical universe of constantly moving gears. Using your iPhone or iPod Touch’s accelerometer, navigate your way through four unique and exciting worlds filled with traps, breathtaking jumps and perilous journeys in a world that never stays still. Jump from gear to gear and roll your way through a unique steampunk-inspired adventure all while collecting achievements and other special bonuses. Try to beat your best level times, or those from around the world with integrated Apple GameCenter support. Gears redefines the ball-roller from a dull, 2D game of ”avoid the holes” to one that’s dynamic and filled with challenges that will keep you coming back time and time again. Once you’ve played Gears, you’ll never look at ball-rollers the same way.

Features:

Unique 3D ball-roller that immerses you into the world of Gears. This is like no other ball-roller you’ve ever seen!
3 uniquely styled worlds filled with 27 challenging levels
A whimsical, fantasy-steampunk inspired design.
Retina display graphics
iPad 2 Enhanced Graphics
Apple GameCenter integration with achievements and time-based scoring.




Source: The Game Website.

103156.name: MapleStory: Thief Edition
103156.description:
Do you have what it takes to turn a lowly thief into the savior of Maple World? MapleStory: Thief Edition brings all the wonder, excitement, humor, and characters of the beloved original online phenomenon to an exciting new side-scrolling action/RPG.

From outcast to hero, this thief’s story is your story!

Source: The Developer Website.

103157.name: MapleStory: Cygnus Knights Edition
103157.description:
Maplestory Cygnus edition is a side scrolling RPG game that contains various skills, world maps, and costumes. The game takes players to the most lively, exciting game experience with gorgeous graphics and a rich storyline; you can enjoy the best Maplestory of the whole series with different kinds of mini games, online matches, community skills and monster riding.

Source: The Developer Website.

103158.name: Mass Effect: Pinnacle Station
103158.description:
User Summary

Pinnacle Station is the second downloadable content pack for Mass Effect. This piece of DLC has a much more-action-oriented approach than the main game or the Bring Down the Sky DLC, as there are no ongoing story aspects to it, only the simulated battles.

In this pack, the Normandy docks aboard a secret Alliance space station where the player can run a series of thirteen battle simulations.

The new unlockables include new achievements and a new set of weapons and armor for Commander Shepard.

103159.name: Indian Scout
103159.description:
Native American themed family game for 2-4 players. With assistance children of all ages can play, though the simple wooden movers might be hazardous to children under the age of 3. The game employs a simple spin-and-move mechanism where the first player to reach the finish wins. Players move ahead the number spun. There are spaces on the board with special instructions indicated by the red arrowheads. If a player lands on one of those spaces the player must follow the instructions. If a player lands on an occupied space, that player moves back 5 spaces.

It's a classic late 1930's American game with simple mechanics and tremendous graphic appeal.

103162.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 20 - Jan 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103162.description:
TIMES Offices Move South!

From the Credits:

The TIMES is a newsletter dedicated to the playing and promotion of Game Designers' Workshop's roleplaying games.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

103165.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 21 - Feb 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103165.description:
Space 1889 Has Arrived!

From the Credits:

The TIMES is a newsletter dedicated to the playing and promotion of Game Designers' Workshop's roleplaying games.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

103167.description: This 63-card expansion brings 8 new Legendary Units to the game (like the ones included in War Stories). These Units (and the new Awards included) represent the lesser known (and often forgotten) countries and cultures that helped the Allied cause: Australia, New Zealand, Poland, Belgium, Norway, Brazil, along with the Maori and the African-Americans. Included are the famous "Buffalo Soldiers" of the US 92nd Infantry Division, the Brazilian Expeditionary Force, the No.10 (Inter-Allied) Commando, and more.
103167.name: D-Day Dice: Heroes
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

103168.name: Shoot the Crow
103168.description: Target shooting game. Shooter uses a cardboard gun as a platform for aiming a rubber band loaded with a wooden ball at standing crow targets. Each of the crow targets has a different point value (five or ten) based on the size/shape of the crow silhouette. First player to hit targets totaling 25 points wins the game.

103170.name: Crusade
103170.description:
This is an abstract strategy game for two to four players based on a checkers theme. A spinner is employed for movement. Moves are made in a straight line, forward, backward or sideways, but not diagonally. The point of the spinner corresponding in color to the player's knights indicates the number of moves the player may make.

The object of the game is to get as many knights as possible into any of the other players' castles, and also to score by capturing the opponents' knights. A capture may be made by a player spinning a number that will land his knight directly in a space occupied by an opponent's knight when not on the gold field or in a castle. Knights may be passed or jumped at any time but they are safe from capture on the gold field or in a castle.

The winner is determined by the score of points. For each knight captured the player scores five points. For each knight moved to opponent's castle the player scores 15 points. The game can be played to conclusion, even though one or two players may be eliminated.

103171.name: Indoor Highland Games
103171.description:
One of the truly great sporting events in the world is the Highland Games of Scotland. Played outdoors for centuries, now transported to your living room.
Take part in such modern classics as Tossing the 2HB, Jockionary, Vegetarian Sword Dancing and How High is my Sporran.

Components:
24 cards with activities on them
5 tiddlywinks.

Each turn a player draws one of the cards from the deck. This card explains what the mini game will be for this round. It could be a physical activity or a quiz on Scottish things.
The card explains the rules of the game and how to play it.
Players compete over several rounds to try to amass the most points through competing in these mini, modified 'indoor highland games'.
The winner is the person or team with the most points at the end of 5 rounds.

103172.name: The Rift: A Scifi Boardgame
103172.description:
Annihilation Imminent!

It looms before you like a great gaping maw, threatening to consume everything: a vast hole in space and time, of matter and void, warping the very fabric of reality, causing chaos and unexplainable, horrific events. It grows at an exponential rate, leaving you precious little time to research the cause and find a solution that will mend the Rift and save the universe!

From 2-4 players will race across the Cosmos trying to gather enough technology to seal the Rift before it’s too late. Conquer planets, fight aliens and avoid deadly hazards. They are only means to an end in your time-critical mission.

Planets are setup randomly so gameplay is different every time. Events have large effects on the board so players must be careful as to where they move and conquer. Once you have captured enough Aliens, their combined research points will help you to buy Tech which will not only help against your enemies but is necessary to seal the Rift. Uses 12-sided dice.

103173.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 22 - Mar 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103173.description:
New Column Starts This Month!

From the Credits:

The TIMES is a newsletter dedicated to the playing and promotion of Game Designers' Workshop's roleplaying games.

Editor: Mark "Mad Geo" Gelinas

103174.description:
Reise ins Tierreich: Mitbringspiel distills the essence of the board game Reise ins Tierreich, also released in 2011, into a tinier package with players once again trying to play animal cards that best other animal cards in certain values.

The game includes 33 animal cards – with a card showing one of six continents and one of five types of animals: mammal, amphibian, reptile, bird, fish – a set of ten category tokens and four "dice tokens". Each card shows the animal image on one side and has stats about that animal's weight, height/length, longevity and number of offspring on the other. Each player starts the game with three animal cards in hand, and the category tokens are placed in a circle with a shared pawn on one token.

On a player's turn, she throws the dice tokens, then moves the sum of the pips being shown. If she lands on a regular category token, she can use the side showing – say, "longevity, oldest" – or flip the token to the other side – which might be "offspring, fewest". Each player then chooses a card in hand and reveals it simultaneously. The player whose animal best fit the category places that animal card before her and draws a replacement card. Everyone else returns their card to hand.

If the player lands on a continent or animal token, she chooses a specific continent or animal type as well as one of the four animal stats and whether players want to be high or low. Each player then chooses an animal card and reveals, with the winning player(s) placing that card before them and drawing a replacement. (A player can swap out an entire hand of cards, but must sit out the next challenge.)

The first player to have five cards before her wins the game.
103174.name: Reise ins Tierreich: Mitbringspiel

103176.description:
In Hui Buh: Die verflixte Gespensterjagd, Count Morticor has imprisoned the royal family and while the ghost Hui Buh has been covered with chains, you still have a chance to direct the ghost to help the family escape.

To set up the game the first time, players need to take the string included in the box and form a loop on one end while tying the other end to a plastic key. Before the game begins, the players shuffle the twelve dungeon tiles – seven of which are blank on both sides while five hide a member of the royal family – then place the tiles in the plastic grid in the box bottom.

On a player's turn, she tries to use the rope to maneuver the key into the slot on one of the dungeon tiles and pick it up, after which she can then look at the tile. If the tile is blank, she can return it to any empty spot in the grid and try to "fish" for a new dungeon tile. If she finds a member of the royal family, she keeps the tile and her turn ends. Meanwhile, the other players are rolling a die that bears the face of Count Morticor among many blank sides. Each time the Count appears, disturbed by the rattling chains persumably, the players grab one of seven ghost chips. If they grab all seven before the active player rescues a member of the royal family, that player's turn ends immediately.

Whoever rescues the most members of the royal family wins the game.
103176.name: Hui Buh: Die verflixte Gespensterjagd

103177.name: Mein Hundequiz
103177.description:
Translated game description from the publisher:

What do you know about dogs? In this exciting trivia game, you can put your knowledge to the test and learn new and interesting things about dogs.

How does a dog's sense of smell compare to that of a man? What does a puppy get out of playing with a squeaky toy? The exciting questions and multiple choice answers in Mein Hundequiz are complemented by brilliant dog photos.

103178.description:
The Age of Dinosaurs is an interactive strategy board game.

Theme: Players migrate populations of twelve dinosaur species across varying habitats in a quest to find food and avoid being eaten. Just as in a real ecosystem, each different species occupies its own niche, with different food requirements, fighting ability, speed, and favored habitats. The arrangement of the various habitats changes from game to game. To play the game well, a player must determine which combination of species will be most advantageous on a given board, and place their dinosaurs in locations where they will be able to find food and mates and avoid being eaten.

Game-play: Play is organized into rounds. Each round consists of the players' turns and an End Phase in which the board is adjusted to prepare for the next round. Each player begins with 10 points of dinosaurs on the board, and increases this point total in two ways: (1) by successfully breeding dinosaurs to produce eggs, which hatch into new dinosaurs at the end of the round; (2) by introducing a new species during the End Phase.
During a turn, a player rolls dice to determine the locations of new plant growth on the board, migrates dinosaurs to new locations, and attempts to feed and breed dinosaurs. For predators, feeding involves hunting other dinosaurs. Other players become involved with the current player's turn when their dinosaurs are hunted, and they must choose to fight or flee, and when they choose to play a card that impacts the current player's actions.
During the End Phase, fresh kills become rotten carcasses, rotten carcasses rot away entirely, hungry dinosaurs starve, eggs hatch, and players have an opportunity to choose one of four improvements for the following round (various combinations of new dinosaurs, eggs, and cards).

Goal: The game ends when at least one player has reached 40 points at the end of a round. The player with the highest point total at that time wins.
103178.name: The Age of Dinosaurs

103179.name: First Class Flurry
103179.description:
From the developer's website:

In First Class Flurry, players take on the role of Claire, Starlink Airline's top flight attendant. The game has players servicing passengers in Economy Class up to Royal First Class and beyond.

First Class Flurry's merging of the unique commercial airliner setting with challenging time management gameplay has been highly praised by critics with GameZebo.com giving the game a 4.5 out of 5 stars rating and stating "First Class Flurry engrosses from the first plane trip and doesn't stop."

103180.name: Westward IV: All Aboard
103180.description:
From the developer's website:

Ride the rails to fun and adventure in Westward® IV: All Aboard, the fourth chapter in the thrilling real-time strategy franchise from Sandlot Games! Download Game and Play for Free!

When the patriarchal owner of the Turner Railroad Company goes missing, his children, Anne and Henry, are called upon to uncover the truth behind his disappearance. Protect the family business from greedy bandits as you help the Turners expand their railway to neighboring towns. Rescue kidnapped citizens being held for exorbitant ransoms, battle greedy bandits, and guide your town to fortune and prosperity in Westward IV: All Aboard!

103181.name: Airline Tycoon Deluxe
103181.description:
From the developer's website:

Airline Tycoon Deluxe is a funny economy simulation proceeding in realtime and assigning you the complete responsibility for an airline. However, don’t be fooled by the funny comic style or the included jokes: A variety of tasks are requested and your competitors never miss a chance to set a trap for you in order to put a spoke in your wheel.

Your abilities are put to the test continuously playing Airline Tycoon Deluxe: Will you be able to use your aeroplanes to capacity and land some profitable charter flights? Can you establish routes for lucrative scheduled flights? Aeroplanes cost millions; will you be capable of increasing the share price and obtaining enough funds by the issuing of securities?

Can you stand up for the construction of new aeroplanes in your role as an engineer? Are you able to avoid your competitors’ deceitful attacks? Accept this unusual challenge and win virtual laurels with Airline Tycoon. The deluxe version contains 20 new airports as well as new opportunities. It is as interesting for professional tycoons as for beginners.

Features:
- Funny economy simulation in comic style
- Complete freedom of action and freedom to move within the airport facilities and more than 30 places to be visited
- Control of all parts of management: purchase of aeroplanes and their fittings, financing as well as stock market listing, planning of routes and filling order books, personnel, marketing and maintenance as well as many other details
- Easily operated construction of own aeroplanes and the opportunity to exchange these on the Internet
- Use additional security precautions against competitors’ attacks or sabotage competitors yourself

103182.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Play Agricola with a new thematic setting! Discover the Netherlands – a small country with more than just the stereotypical windmills, cheese, and tulips. The 60 Minor Improvements and 60 Occupations in the 120-card Agricola: NL-Deck expansion can be played as a stand-alone deck or shuffled into other decks.

The Dutch version of this deck is included in Agricola: De Lage Landen from 999 Games.
103182.name: Agricola: NL-Deck

103183.description:
The WM-Deck for Agricola is a new set of cards for Uwe Rosenberg’s boardgame hit. The 60 Minor Improvements and 55 Occupations are divided into 5 Mini-Decks and were created for the first Agricola World Championship 2011 in Vienna. The card set was designed and tested by users of the internet portal Play-Agricola. Play there and create your own cards!


The five mini-decks can be shuffled together to form a single deck that can be played by itself or mixed into some or all of the EGIK decks. Or, you can play the mini-decks.

How to play the Mini-Decks
There are several ways to play the minidecks (labelled alpha, beta, gamma, delta and epsilon)

To learn to utilize the decks: each player gets one deck and discards down to 7 occupations and 7 minor improvements.




Either randomize who's getting what deck or (for experienced players) let players bid for the decks they want to play.


Or: Play a Booster Draft. Each player gets a deck. First, draft Occupations in clockwise direction until everyone has 7. Then, draft Improvements counter-clockwise until everyone has 7.



Or: play any other draft format where you need boosters.


courtesy of Hanno Girke (Lookout Games)
103183.name: Agricola: World Championship Deck – 2011

103184.description:
Welcome to the world of the Gnomes of Zavandor.

Like most gnomes, you have two great passions: sparkling gems and wondrous machines.
The sought-after gemstones can be found around the mining town of Diamantina. They can be bought and sold at the gem exchange, shady traders are always willing to engage in a little wheeling and dealing, and then you can use the gems to claim valuable mining rights, artifacts and jewellery. Who will become the most successful gem trading mogul?

Zavandor is a fantasy setting which revolves around a capitalist economy based on trading in gems - sapphires, rubies, mystical gems etc. Other games in the family include Mines of Zavandor, and The Scepter of Zavandor.

Gnomes of Zavandor features two central boards. The first is a grid with markers indicating the current price of each of the gem types, and also indicating whether the price is going to go up or down next turn. Gems can be bought (or sold) for cash in the first phase of each turn. Buying gems makes them more valuable in subsequent turns; selling them reduces their value, and this is reflected on the grid. These gems can be used to buy tiles from the second board, a star-shaped arena featuring "mining rights" tiles positioned randomly around it. The position on the board indicates the cost to purchase these mining rights; the cost will be a mixed selection of coloured gems. At the end of each turn, players gain new gems according to the mining rights they have acquired and this affects the central economy, generally reducing the value of the relevant gems when they are purchased for hard cash, in future rounds.

The initial phase of the turn involves buying gems, selling gems, taking gold, trading with the central supply, and purchasing cards and tokens (with gems rather than cash). The items available for purchase include equipment improving your efficiency, jewels providing victory points, and mining rights. The second phase of the turn involves mining for new gems. Each player takes the gems they are allowed according to their mining rights. At the end of each turn, the market values are adjusted according to the actions which have occurred; the price of the available equipment is discounted (this rule is optional); and another area of the star-shaped board becomes accessible with more mining-rights available to purchase in the next round.

The game continues until one player has reached a victory-point target, dependent on the number of players in the game. Victory points are achieved by purchasing mining-rights, equipment, and most significantly (but also most expensively) jewellery.
103184.name: The Gnomes of Zavandor
boardgameaccessory: The Gnomes of Zavandor: Turn Summary Card

103185.description:
Walnut Grove is a cross between jigsaw puzzles and worker placement, with the players as farmers who find their plots merging into a single landscape as time passes and their holdings grow. Come fall they must head to the city with their goods as winter will soon return.


Walnut Grove could be described as a light mashup between Carcassonne and Agricola. The goal of the game is to develop your own ranch. The better the ranch, the more points you will score at the end of the game. Players can improve their ranch during the game by adding new land tiles to it, hiring more workers, building improvements, etc

The game play is divided into eight years, and each year is divided into Spring, Summer, Fall and Winter phases. During Spring, players add land tiles to their ranch. During Summer, players place their workers to gather resources from the fields. When Autumn comes, all players get to visit the city. Finally, during the Winter phase, players need to feed their workers and heat their homes.

In the city you can hire workers, trade goods to coins, build improvements, and so on. Each player may do only one action in the city though. The city is a kind of rondel that is divided into halves; each time you cross the midline you have to pay a coin. Therefore it is wise to move as slowly as possible on the rondel, but then again, you have consider what actions you want to take!

The land areas will produce resources when you place the workers there. Also, the tiles do not need to match, but you want them to, as larger areas of the same type will give you greater production.

Spring, Summer and Winter phases can be done simultaneously, providing fast game play. The game also works as a solo game.
103185.name: Walnut Grove
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 18 – Top 10 Filler Games & Jason Kotarski | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 12: Pax of Walnuts
Episode 33 - Discussing Area Control/Majority with Two Players
Episode 67- Kingdom Death: Monster and Women Representations in Games
Episodio 4 – Get Bit!, Inventum y Essen 2011
Ludology Episode 51 - 50 for 50, Part 2
The Game Pit - Episode 56 - The Bumper Review of 2015 (with Top 5s)
The Spiel #148 - Circle the Wagons

103186.description: Bohn Camillo, a Bohnanza variant for two players only, is a take-off of the movie Don Camillo e l'on. Peppone, with the title characters having a love-hate relationship in which they fight each other, spy on each other, and steal from each other – all while trying to thwart their antogonist's plans. Only the "Bohn Gottes" – the Bean God – who hangs on the cross stands between the two and can prevent the worst, although when the situation warrants they can be generous to one another.
103186.name: Bohn Camillo

103187.name: The Purple Worm Graveyard
103187.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

It is said that when the largest and most ancient of purple worms know that the time of their death is near, they make their way through rock, earth, and water to the legendary Purple Worm Graveyard.

The graveyard is said to lie somewhere in the barren Rockspyre mountains, but its exact location is unknown. Now and then an adventuring expedition sets out on a hunch or clue seeking the graveyard. Most return empty-handed and dispirited. Some never return.

But a few, just enough to keep the legend alive really, come back with whispered tales of subterranean fields littered with a fortune in purple ivory, unguarded and ripe for the take.

The Purple Worm Graveyard is a short dungeon crawl adventure that's best for levels 1-4. The adventure has 15 entries and is designed to provide a variety of challenges for a new adventuring party or one-shot game. It's got fabulous treasures, cunning monsters, dangerous traps, and ancient mysteries for players to discover and explore. It's written using the Labyrinth Lord rules, but will work with any dungeon crawl adventure game.

103188.name: Alpha Prime
103188.description:
User Summary

You are playing the role as a mining inspector who is tasked with exploring an illegal asteroid mining base to investigate the disappearance of its inhabitants.
To solve this job, you are dropped into a maze of rooms, halls, corridors, mining facilities and shafts of an apparently abandoned deep-space asteroid mining base, facing rebellious machinery of assorted robots and automatic systems, which you have to defeat and demolish, using your weapons and wits. The story is strong, and spiced with fast paced shooting action. However, if you cannot shoot, then there is your RECON, hacking device enabling you to remotely control the various devices you meet, (robots, manipulators, surveillance cameras, security systems, weapons etc.), on your way through the dark halls and corridors of Alpha Prime.
The game features 10 levels full of action, 5 non-playable characters to help you, 14 different enemies - including Special Forces soldiers, robots and crazy miners, 8 futuristic weapons including pistol, shotgun, machinegun, grenades etc. and Devices to hack - including a variety of robots and manipulators, surveillance cameras, and security systems.

103189.name: Flipping Crazy
103189.description:
Flipping Crazy is an Othello (or Reversi if you prefer) like game that uses a hexagonal board for play. Players place and move pieces in an attempt to have the most of their own color on the board.

Players can expand from current piece locations, or move already played pieces 2 spaces away. Players take opponents pieces by being adjacent to them.

When no more moves can be made, the player with the most of pieces on the board wins.

103190.name: John Deere - American Builder Deluxe
103190.description:
User Summary

"American Builder Deluxe" is a 3D construction economic simulator with 18 scenarios, 5 kinds of workers, 6 kinds of vehicles, and many different buildings and structures which you can built. Create and manage construction sites and projects using authentic John Deere equipment, including excavators, loaders, and dozers. Hire and manage contractors and specialists to help build your structures, and work 8 construction sites across North America - spanding from Campuses in New York to Movie studios in California.
You are in charge of getting projects done on time and under budget.
In the course of your career you will unlock various vehicles and buildings.

103191.description: They were the most powerful nations of their time: the Carthaginians, Romans, Hellenes, Egyptians and Persians. Pergamemnon assembles all of these peoples for an epic showdown. Each side may also conjure mythical creatures in order to influence the battle in its favor to gain the victory. Pergamemnon is a deck-building game of direct conflict, with clashes between the most powerful nations of antiquity – thus including plenty of interaction!
103191.name: Pergamemnon

103192.description:
An exciting race through a haunted castle.

Answer trivia, complete rhymes and recite tongue twisters based on classic horror stories and films to advance through the haunted castle. The first player to reach the Black Raven wins!
103192.name: Gespensterburg

103193.name: Cell Bound
103193.description:
User Summary

Cell Bound is a matching puzzle game set in a Petri Dish. The goal is to keep the cells from overwhelming the dish. This is accomplished by matching five or more cells of the same color to eliminate them. If things get to out of control you can use a bomb to clear out the screen.

There are three modes included with the game:
Infinite Mode - Main mode as described above.
Timer Mode - Try to score as many points in one minute and thirty seconds.
Burst Mode - For an additional challenge cells turn black if they are not the same color as those they are next to making them unable to react.

103195.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The trumpets blare and your horses are ready. The moment of truth is at hand as the Emperor himself signals the start of the race. You guide your chariot around the racing oval using all the skill, savvy, and if need be, savagery, in the quest to finish first. The quest for fame and fortune is on and none shall stand in your way. Welcome to the world of Charioteer!

Relive the glory that was Rome with this fast-paced chariot racing game. Charioteer includes two levels of play:

• Charioteer - As a Charioteer, you spend your entire time chariot racing, trying to gain experience and find work in the best of places, Rome herself.
• Patron - As a Patron, the head of a chariot Racing Faction, you buy and sell both horses and charioteers alike, then put up the money to enter the races, all with the hope of winning more fame and a chance to race in Rome herself.

In either case, you must learn your trade on the fringe of the Empire and work your way to your ultimate goal, racing at the famous Circus Maximus in Rome herself!
103195.name: Charioteer: Racing at the Famous Circus Maximus

103196.name: CJ in the USA
103196.description:
User Summary:

You play CJ a baby elephant whose brothers and sisters have been abducted by the Hunter. Not knowing where they are, you start on a cross country quest around the USA. You must jump off platforms, avoid spikes and fend off an assortment of critters trying to stop you. On the bright side, you have an unlimited amount of peanuts you can fire as projectiles as well as a few bombs.

CJ in the USA is the second game of the CJ Elephant series.

103197.name: Monkey Hero
103197.description:
In the game you play as Monkey, a monkey sent to the planet to save the world from the Nightmare King, and, under the guidance of master sage, he must capture all of the pieces of the magic story book and defeat the Nightmare King. The world is displayed on a map and even though the outside map is not large, it was great for the time of its creation, also, overall it is very large if you include the dungeons.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monkey Hero," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103198.name: O.D.T.: Escape...or Die Trying
103198.description:
O.D.T. - Escape...Or Die Trying, is a video game created by Psygnosis for the PlayStation and Microsoft Windows. It is a 3D action-adventure, with some role-playing elements. Playing as 1 of 4 characters, your goal is to explore the "Forbidden Zone" to look for gas canisters to re-inflate your balloon, which had crashed on the roof of a mysterious tower. Along the way you solve puzzles, battle monsters, and so on. An N64 version was completed but never released, though it has recently been leaked online.

Source: Wikipedia, "O.D.T.," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103199.name: Moto X Simulator
103199.description:
User Summary:

Ride a dirt bike and jump over obstacles such as rocks, chasms, logs and sand dunes. You must land on your back wheel to avoid falling. Furthermore, make sure you finish each section within the time limit to advance. Moto Χ Simulator is an exciting racing game where all your skills are put to test.

103200.name: El Portal de Karshit
103200.description:
From the back of the book:

El Portal de Karshit es una gran campaña en la Europa fantástica. Empieza cuando los aventureros toman fortuitamente posesión de una tablilla mortuoria, viéndose al tiempo sumergidos en la vil trama de la campaña.

Visita Micenas, Venecia o piérdete en siniestros laberintos, lucha contra fantasmas, hombres y monstruos, mientras te adentras en un misterio sobrecogedor.

English Translation

The Karshit Portal is a campaign in a fantastic Europe. It begins when the adventurers fortuitously take possession of a funerary tablet, then immerse themselves in the wicked campaign plot.

Visit Mycenae and Venice, get lost in scary laberinths and fight ghosts, monsters and men while you go deeper into a breathtaking mystery.

User comment

This module exists only in Spanish.

103201.name: Wie weet wat Quiz
103201.description:
The "Wie weet wat Quiz" is an educational family game with questions about six categories.
Each player has to move over the board answering questions to move his meeple, and in the same time trying to block other meeples paths and not be blocked himself.
Goal of the game is to reach the finish first

103202.name: Twin Turbo V8
103202.description:
User Summary:

You are driving a Ferrari F40, one of the most powerful cars ever. Your task is to drive through five stages, against the clock and plenty of opponents. You must also avoid hills and make it safe through twists and turns. Can you make it to the next stage in one piece?

103203.name: Petty-Magick, Petty-Sorcerers and Hedge Wizards
103203.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to the Demesnes of Petty-Magick!

Here you will find a new magic system for the RuneQuest Roleplaying Game: Petty Magick. Designed to empower low-level spellcasters with new flexibility, and enabling reuse of existing Rune Spells, the skill-based Petty-Magick system can be included in any campaign.

Included in this packed sourcebook:

Rules for learning and researching new spells
Talismans, magical focii to empower spellcasters
Rules for binding and commanding Familiars, the loyal companions and scouts of Hedge Wizards
Over 30 new Rune Spells usable by Petty-Magick users or by Runecasters, easily able to be absorbed into any campaign
Create a storm with extended Rules for weather and Weatherworking
New Professions for Petty-Magick characters: the Petty-Sorcerer, the nature-loving Hedge Wizard, Sea Witches, Weatherworkers and more...
The Demesnes of Necromancy and Chaos to give dread new depths to your Player Character’s opponents.

103204.name: Textropolis
103204.description:
User Summary

Textopolis is a word game where you search for words in each city. If you get stuck, you can shake your iPhone or iPod to get a hint.

103205.name: Blood-Soaked Dawn
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103205.description:
From "Adventure Background and Summary:"

The wall of the gods has long protected Onara from land-based incursions of the unbound infernals that resided behind the hills. A little known phenomenon known as the Wall of Yarris prevented ships from reaching the shoreline past the Wall of the Gods, and ships from leaving the shoreline there. However, when the Wall of the Gods fell, so did the Wall of Yarris, leaving the seas of Onara open at last to these infernals.

Not too long ago a band of dangerous infernals and the tainted ones who worship them struck out on a fleet of warships. They have been traveling down the coast of the Hinterlands, raiding and slaughtering wherever they may.

The adventure starts with the PCs just arriving at a small Hinterlands village, to find it destroyed and burning. In the distance can be seen the Infernal fleet sailing south. There are several options that the PCs have, they can attempt to hunt for survivors, they can search for a vessel to follow them in, or they can simply chase them on horseback.

103206.name: Artifice & Espionage: The Arts of Subterfuge
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103206.description:
From "Adventure Background and Summary:"

The day dawns like any other in Freeport. The Shipping News comes out, with the announcement of Kolter’s demonstration as the main headline. Additional headlines speak of the aftermath of the war, and the arrival of an Altherian fleet.

Furthermore, the PCs are all contacted in various means and receive Secret Orders. Finally, the various factions within the captain’s council all send out runners with notices proclaiming their need for assistance.

103207.name: Secrets of the Serpent's Teeth
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103207.description:
From "Adventure Background and Summary:"

The tunnels beneath Freeport have always held secrets, or at least since the time of the valossan empire. Now, the PCs are asked to investigate reports of horrors deep beneath the city by the Captain’s Council.

103208.name: The Sea Lord's Return
rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
103208.description:
From "Adventure Background and Summary:"

The invasion of the Infernal fleet, the troubles amongst the various factions within the city, the renewed threat of Ymandragore, the threat of war with Altheria, and the rumors of horrors hidden beneath the city have driven it to become a tinder keg.

The Cult of Yig, hidden and thought destroyed, has been biding its time, building strength and waiting for just such a situation as this. K’stallo has been preparing some special documents which he is going to have the clergy of Althares distribute throughout the city.

These documents are the first step in an even more cunning plan than the lighthouse was. With the assistance of Captain Xavier Gordon (a member of the Captain’s Council, whose term was extended until the Sea Lord is elected) he has arranged for a gala party and festival to be held to celebrate the renewal of the city, and the aversion of some many of the recent troubles to afflict the city.

During this festival they are planning on revealing a pair of massive banners that complete the ritual that the earlier papers began.

As a complement to this, Captain Xavier has been using the recent politicsl troubles to reshape the landscape of politics and work his way into being the new Sea Lord.

103209.name: War Inc. Battlezone
103209.description:
War Inc. Battle Zone delivers hard hitting combat action to you in a free to play, online multiplayer, session-based shooter game, where you will compete with your friends and other players in real time, action packed team vs. team ground combat. All for Free! You can take it slow and easy, or rock as hard as you want to!

War Inc. Battle Zone is set in a world where Mercenary and Paramilitary Commando Units rule the day. Some had said that 2012 wasn't the end of the world, but it damn near might as well have been. The global economic chaos that started in 2008 had run rampant for almost 4 years. National fortunes were squandered and lost. International trade turned into international hostility and deprivation. A number of Nations disintegrated into anarchy and civil war as all out conflict broke out between various Nations. International corporate powers emerged with in different countries, demanding controls and powers from spineless government officials and a bad situation simply got worse. Death, Famine, Pestilence, and War spread as if the 4 Horsemen of the Apocalypse had actually been released from the Gates of Hell.

Onto this stage of conflict and chaos there emerged a growing need for Mercenary Units and Paramilitary Command Units who could execute orders and carry out fast assignments for governments and corporations, allowing the employers plausible deniability as well as the ability to say that they were in no way involved with certain “Black Operations” and “Pirate Like Undertakings”. The new age of the Mercenary had dawned and with it, ruthless Men and Women took on combat and bloody warfare for assets, money, and power. Units and Unions were formed and broken as Clan like structures and Shadow Organizations emerged to be major players in the events that played out on the Global Stage. In War Inc. Battle Zone you are a member of one of these Units. Can you survive? Can you win? Can you take your game to the top?

Source: The Game Website.

User Summary
This is a free 3rd person shooter, where you can earn gold and XP while playing. You start with 1 'kit' (for instance: sniper) and can purchase new equipment, weapons, abilities and looks (even your ingame head) by spending gold or in the store. Earning gold however, is a labour intensive job and of course it's much faster to spend real dollars on the gear. Prices range from a few dollars to dozens of bucks for 1 complete kit.

103210.name: Catrap
103210.description:
Pitman, also known as Catrap, is a puzzle-platform video game released by Asmik for the Nintendo Game Boy in 1990, after originally being developed for the Sharp MZ-700 computer in 1985. The word 'Catrap' refers to the frequent amount of times the player is trapped and needs to reverse their movements and the two anthropomorphic cats the player can maneuver to advance through the levels. The game is credited with having originated the time-rewind mechanic, which later appeared in titles like Blinx: The Time Sweeper, Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time, and Braid.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pitman (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103211.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 23 - Apr 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103211.description:
COACC Should Reach Stores Soon!

From the Credits:

The TIMES is a newsletter dedicated to the playing and promotion of Game Designers' Workshop's roleplaying games.

Editor: Mark "Geo" Gelinas

103212.name: Power League II
103212.description:
User Summary

Power League II is the second TurboGrafx-16 baseball game in the Power League series. Power League II was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103213.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 24 - May 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103213.description:
Schedule Change for TIMES

From the Credits:

The TIMES is a newsletter dedicated to the playing and promotion of Game Designers' Workshop's roleplaying games.

Editor: Mark "Geo" Gelinas

103214.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 25 - Jul 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103214.description:
Major Changes for Club and TIMES

From the Credits:

The TIMES is a newsletter dedicated to the playing and promotion of Game Designers' Workshop's roleplaying games.

Editor: Mark "Geo" Gelinas

103215.name: Pro Powerboat Simulator
103215.description:
User Summary:

In this powerful, instantaneous action game you get to race across water using a state-of-the-art powerboat. Steer clear of deadly mines, bomb dropping helicopters and other obstacles, and blow other boats out of the water. Be aware of your fuel level as running out is surely going to send you on an expedition to study the ocean floor!

103216.name: Periodic Quest: Card and Board Game Set
103216.description:
Periodic Quest: Card and Board Game Set

Some of the games included in the set are described below

Atomic Rummy Card Game
Each player adds one card from the deck or play area to his/her collection and plays a card. Goal of each player is to make complete sets of cards that form well defined patterns on the Periodic Table. The game continues till the deck is empty. Player who comes up with patterns using maximum number of cards is the winner of the game. For 2 to 6 players, No prior chemistry knowledge required.

Atomic Number Card Game
Each player adds one card from the shuffled deck to his/here collection and places a card on the table from the collection. At the end of each round, the player who played the card with the highest value that matches the starting card type wins the round. The game continues until all the cards in the deck are played. The player with the highest sum of card value wins the game. For 4 to 8 players. No prior chemistry knowledge required.

Compound Formula Card Game
Each player adds one card from the shuffled deck to his/her collection and places a card on the table form the collection. If some or all cards on the table can be used to recreate formula of a chemical compound, the player claims those cards. The game continues until all the cards in the deck are played. The player with the highest sum of the cards value wins the game. For 4 to 8 players .Basic chemistry knowledge is required

Atomic Shell Card Game
Each player adds one card from the shuffled deck to his/her collection and place a card on the table form the collection. If the sum of electrons in the outer shells of the cards satisfies some predefined conditions, the player claims those cards. The game continues until all the cards in the deck are played. The player with the highest sum of card value wins the game. For 4 to 8 players

Explorer Board Game
This board game takes players through the Periodic Table and introduces them to various elements and encourages them to challenge their opponents in the understanding of the element properties. For 2 to 4 players . No prior chemistry knowledge required.

Challenger Board Game(s)
These board games challenge players in their ability to recall chemical compound formulas or to identify meaningful patterns on the Periodic Table. Players could maximize the chance of winning by strategically selecting the right combination of elements identified by face values of dice after rolling dice. For 2 to 4 players . No prior chemistry knowledge required for the Rummy version.

103217.name: SAS Combat Simulator
103217.description:
User Summary:

Experience adrenaline pumping action as you try to stay alive fighting in vast swamps. Face overwhelming odds against the continuous onslaught of your enemies. Your machine gun and a limited number of grenades are your most trusted friends. Will you manage to make it out in one piece?

videogame: Company of Heroes: Tales of Valor
103218.name: Company of Heroes: Anthology
videogamecompilation: Company of Heroes: Tales of Valor
103218.description:
User Summary

Company of Heroes: Anthology is a compilation of Company of Heroes and its two add-ons: Opposing Fronts and Tales of Valor.

103219.name: Power League III
103219.description:
User Summary
Power League III is the third TurboGrafx-16 baseball game in the Power League series. Power League III was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103220.name: Power League IV
103220.description:
User Summary

Power League IV is the fourth TurboGrafx-16 baseball game in the Power League series. Power League IV was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103221.name: Power League V
103221.description:
User Summary

Power League V is the fifth TurboGrafx-16 baseball game in the Power League series. Power League V was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103222.name: Power League '93
103222.description:
User Summary
Power League '93 is the sixth TurboGrafx-16 baseball game in the Power League series. Power League '93 was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103223.name: Super Power League
103223.description:
User Summary

Super Power League is the first Super Nintendo baseball game in the Power League series. Super Power League was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103224.name: Super Power League 2
103224.description:
User Summary

Super Power League 2 is the second Super Nintendo baseball game in the Power League series. Super Power League 2 was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103225.name: Super Power League 3
103225.description:
User Summary
Super Power League 3 is the third Super Nintendo baseball game in the Power League series. Super Power League 3 was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103226.name: Super Power League 4
103226.description:
User Summary

Super Power League 4 is the fourth Super Nintendo baseball game in the Power League series. It is also the last game in the Power League series. Super Power League 4 was considered to be a realistic baseball sim in its time. This title has never been released outside of Japan.

103227.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 26 - Oct 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
103227.description:
Happy Holidays from the TIMES!

From the Credits:

The Terra Traveller Club is an association of players and referees dedicated to the playing and promotion of GDW RPGs in general and MEGATRAVELLER in particular.

The TIMES is a newsletter of the Terra Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Geo" Gelinas

103229.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 27 - Jan 1990)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
How to Ref 2300AD Without Alienating Your Characters.
103229.description:
Special Diaspora Issue

From the Credits:

The Terra Traveller Club is an association of players and referees dedicated to the playing and promotion of GDW RPGs in general and MEGATRAVELLER in particular.

The TIMES is a newsletter of the Terra Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Geo" Gelinas

103230.name: Android: "We're tracking you in free fall"
103230.description: A single-card expansion that can be obtained by using the order form in the "Free Fall" book from Fantasy Flight Games. This is an event card entitled “We’re tracking you in free fall” and makes the Beanstalk a dangerous place to be.

103231.name: Terra Traveller Times (Number 28 - Mar 1990)
rpgissuearticle: Diaspora: Star Lane to the Core
Heroes of the Fifth Frontier War
So You Want to be an Alien? Part I
The Texan Trail, Part I, Remembrance
103231.description:
MTA 1, Vilani and Vargr, Due Soon!

From the Credits:

The Terra Traveller Club is an association of players and referees dedicated to the playing and promotion of GDW RPGs in general and MEGATRAVELLER in particular.

The TIMES is a newsletter of the Terra Traveller Club.

Editor: Mark "Geo" Gelinas

103232.name: Leylines
103232.description:
In this fantasy epic 4X strategy game, conquer the world using your armies and powerful spells.

An intriguing turn-based strategy game of exploration and conquest. Set in a fantasy world, it lets you pit your armies, magic and commerce against up to seven opponents and a horde of barbarians. Start from a single city and work your way up to a grand empire. Train over 150 different units and cast over eighty different spells to gain the upper hand.

Features seven unique races, customizable heroes, tactical combat, special resources, split-screen and hot-seat multiplayer modes, random world generator, map editor and extensive tutorial.

From the developer's website:

103233.description:
Rattus: Africanus, a new expansion for the 2010 release Rattus, introduces a caravan and diplomats to add more strategic possibilities to the game. What's more, with the introduction of region cards, players will have more control on possible outbreaks of the Black Death.

In addition to making Rattus feel like a completely new gaming experience, Rattus Africanus makes it possible to play the game with up to six players.
103233.name: Rattus: Africanus

103234.name: CryptidsTV
103234.description:
CryptidsTV, a new type of party game, challenges players to create new television shows, with them taking part in all aspects of a show's production meetings – drawing, talking and being creative – with the aim of getting their show on prime time. Part of the challenge comes from being presented with two separate concepts drawn from separate card decks – for example, a liquid creature and a fad that appeals to kids – and figuring out how to merge these concepts creatively into a single creation.

Each player takes one role card and reveals it to indicate his role for the game. The assistant director distributes pens and creation sheets to players.

In each round, the director randomly selects one Cryptids card, such as "vehicle creature", then everybody must draw a creature representing this category within one minute. The assistant director redistributes the drawings among players (with players not being allowed to look at them), then the director randomly selects one Show card, such as "The creature is able to communicate and converse with humans! What is the secret behind it?" Each player then makes his presentation using the caption and drawing in hand.

Players then vote on the winning presentation by simultaneously pointing to the show they thought best, with the director breaking ties. The winner is selected to air on prime time, with the player who drew the cryptid receiving the prime time tile, and its reporter receiving the prime time host tile. Everyone gives them a round of applause.

Play four rounds total with 3-6 players, and only three rounds with seven or more players. End the game by kibitzing over the suggestions that were botched and didn't merit air time.

Can be combined with the material in the sequel CryptidsTV 2.

103235.description:
Sir Stamford Raffles has established a post at the southern tip of the Malay Peninsula and is inviting merchants to take ownership of certain plots of land as long as they develop those locations.

In Singapore players are rich merchants who are trading to develop that small outpost into a metropolis. Players own one building at the start of the game, and each round they take ownership of a new lot – with the player who has the fewest points determining who gets which land – and erect a new building. Each building has one or more streets connecting it to adjacent locations, and after building you can move 1-2 workers along the streets to take actions in up to three buildings; these buildings provide a small amount of resources or allow trades of resources/VPs/money for some better combination of resources/VPs/money.

A number of the buildings are black market locations that tend to be more powerful than legit businesses, but carry the possibility of stinging you in the end. Each time you build or use a black market building, you draw a chip from a bag. If the chip is black, keep it; if white, the player who has the most black chips and opium is fined and loses half his opium stash. Opium can be quite profitable, but will the cops catch you with dirty hands before you unload the goods?

In the end, the player with the most victory points wins so find the right balance of aboveboard business and criminal doings.
103235.name: Singapore

103236.name: Fusion
103236.description:
Fusion is a twist by designer Reinhard Staupe on his own Speed/Blink. The card deck consists of 72 cards with each card having a number (1-6), a letter (one of six, which spell out "fusion"), and a color on that letter (one of six). Three rule cards are placed face-up, with one card from the deck placed next to each rule to start a pile.

The remaining cards are dealt evenly among the players, and each player draws the top three cards in hand. Then they simultaneously play cards from their hands onto the three piles, following the rules for play and refilling their hands to three cards whenever they desire. The rules for playing:

• "=" – The card being played must match the color or letter of the card being covered.
• "+1/-1" – The number on the card being played must be one higher or one lower than the card being covered.
• "≠" – The card being played cannot match the number, color or letter of the card being covered.

The first player to run out of cards wins the game.

103237.name: Ninja Massacre
103237.description:
User Summary:

You are a Ninja trying to find the exit to a maze of fifty levels. There are hordes of relentless critters out to get you. All you have is your trusted Shuriken, your martial arts training and a will to survive. Find the keys and collect fruit to restore your energy. You can either play solo or with a friend.

103238.name: Arcade Flight Simulator
103238.description:
User Summary:

Arcade Flight Simulator is a game of three stages and you get to fly a different plane in each of them. A biplane for World War I stage, a Spitfire for World War II stage, and an F14 Tomcat for World War III stage. You have to shoot down a certain number of enemy planes and destroy their bases before you can proceed to the next level.

103239.name: Death Stalker
103239.description:
User Summary:

In Death Stalker you are trapped in a Labyrinth of caves and dungeons. You are trying to find the way out and you can only see whatever is in your line of sight. You will get to fight plenty of merciless ghosts, orcs and skeletons. You will also collect spells and release prisoners along the way. If you are nice to them they will help you. But be careful. You only have one life, so if you die its game over!

103240.name: Power Boat GT
103240.description:
User Summary

Aquadelic GT, a funky new boat racing game with an emphasis on fun!
As a member of the Aquadelic GT league you will fight to win cash prizes and the support of fans around the world, - spanding all from the rivers of Russia and the ports of Greece to luxurious Caribbean islands. You'll have to beat rival racers to the finish, and it won't be easy as you're all armed to the teeth with dragnets, shark torpedos, balloon bombs and even exploding frogs!
As your fame grows, you can land bigger and bigger sponsors - who will pay you even more money! You may be starting in a ramshackle old tub of a boat, but in a very short time you'll be able to buy a fancy speedboat, or a classy catamaran. Turn your newfound fame into money, and spend it to buy lavish new homes. Why live in an apartment in Russia when you could buy your own Caribbean mansion? Between races, you can move around the world looking for sponsors, giving taxi rides, helping out people in need, or even going for joyrides in seaplanes.
Aquadelic GT is a boat racing game in the style of a kart racer - easy to learn, but challenging to master.

103241.name: Around the World in 80 Days
103241.description:
User Summary

You only have 80 days to circumnavigate the globe.
"Around the World in 80 Days" is a tile-matching game based upon the novel of the same name by Jules Verne. As Phileas Fogg you are traveling around the world in 81 stages, searching and collecting the pieces of a broken artifact. These pieces are collected by removing all tiles below them, in a way that they are able to "fall out of the screen". Bonus points and additional time are collected in the same way. At the end of each country you visit, you’ll have to clear all tiles of the stamp, to prove that you actually have been there.
Use this unique chance to visit four continents and complete the inconceivable journey to win the fantastic 20,000 pounds wager with this outstanding puzzler.
The story is told in dialogues between the stages.

103242.name: Ascension to the Throne
103242.description:
User Summary

Ascension to the Throne is a turn-based strategy game with RPG elements in which you play the role of Alexander, king of Airath who was banished beyond the borders of his country without relatives, friends, armies, or money. As the last offspring of the ancient family Illiar, which has ruled Eden for ages, you must fight to regain control of your land. In real-time turn-based battles, you must gather an army to crush the traitorous enemies who have slaughtered your family. Instead of giving orders and watching the battles from a safe place, you participate in the fight yourself.

103244.name: Professional Snooker Simulator
103244.description:
User Summary:

Professional Snooker Simulation is a classic and incredibly lifelike snooker game in which you see the table from a bird's eye view. You get to play against a friend taking turns on the ball, and incorporate all elements of the game. You get to judge the power to hit the ball with and the spin to put on the cue ball. You can even nominate a color after legal shots. The game also includes a practice mode.

103245.name: Bedlam City Campaign Setting (Savage Worlds Edition)
103245.description:
From publisher blurb:

WELCOME TO BEDLAM!

Take a trip back to the Iron Age of comics and visit Bedlam City. It's the smaller, dirtier and more dangerous town next door to your superhero campaign's shining metropolis, presented here in lavish detail. Stalk its alleys, punch out its supervillains, expose its horrible secrets--and have no fear, there are always plenty more where they came from.

Weighing in at a whopping 394 pages, this book is crammed with dozens of NPCs, neighborhoods, adventure seeds and locations, with enough back-stories and plot arcs to keep your PCs playing for years.

Fight the Mafia on the gloomy streets of Stark Hill. Battle the gangs in Wolverton. Face down the sinister cult called the Mara in the back alleys of Hardwick Park. Walk the toxic, deserted streets of the Country Club and see what has taken up residence there, or chase Stabbo the Clown across the roofs of Greely Point.

Fully compatible with the Super Powers Companion Explorer's Edition (and with Necessary Evil Explorer's Edition) Bedlam City is fast, fun and ferocious, with no new rules to learn or systems to memorize. If you own a copy of the Super Powers Companion you can pick up Bedlam City and start playing it right now.

So what are you waiting for? Bedlam is calling. There's a shadowy rooftop out there just waiting for you to start lurking on it...

103246.name: Bedlam City Campaign Setting (Mutants & Masterminds Edition)
103246.description:
From publisher blurb:
Take a trip back to the Iron Age of comics and visit Bedlam City. It’s the smaller, dirtier and more dangerous town next door to your campaign’s shining metropolis, presented here in lavish detail. Weighing in at a whopping 400 pages, this book is crammed with dozens of NPCs, adventure seeds and locations, with enough back-stories and plot arcs to keep your PCs playing for years.
