Cover Art: George Mansford

103441.name: PsychoBabble (Vol 1, Issue 2 - 1995)
rpgissuearticle: How to Run a Pub Quiz
So You Want to Run a LARP? - Part One
103441.description:
From the Front Cover:

"It's all lies, vicious lies I tell you"
Free, totally free!!!!
a gamesmagazine for the discerning oddball
The next Mind-Numbing Issue!
Even A Stopped Clock Gives The Right Time Twice A Day
Inside:
LARP Yourself To Death, Four Letter Elvish? Gamers Vs. The Pentagon.
Plus: News! Articles! Debate? Printed Dementia! And Other Bits!

103442.name: I. N. F. H. (Issue 4, Volume 8 - 1992)
103442.description: Yet another issue of INFH, which is half magazine, and half convention booklet for Spiltræf '92.

103443.name: Hansolo'en (Dec 1995)
103443.description:
User summary:
Visting another RPG-club, fiction, inspiration for roleplayers, Magic cards, and the future.

103444.name: Hansolo'en (May 1996)
103444.description:
User summary:
Review of the Fastaval 96 convention, News from Wizards of the Coast, gossip

103445.name: The Realm of Adventurers (Issue 3 - 1990)
103445.description:
User summary:
The Cavalier, Rolemaster, General assambly, tournaments, spells from Dragonlance, Dragonlance competition, Clublogo, time map, Whats coming uo in TRoA, Monster for AD&D/D&D, Battletech, Letters, Ild og ludobrikker, noticeboard

103446.name: The Realm of Adventurers (Issue 4 - Apr 1991)
103446.description:
User summary:
Somehow I only have the covers of the fanzine, so I can't really write anything about what's inside...

103447.name: Katakomben (Issue 1 - Mar 1994)
103447.description:
User summary:

News and an AD&D adventure.

103448.name: MARS: Adventures in Miniature (Vol 1. Issue 6 - Spring 1998)
103448.description:
SPACE: Call to Arms issue

Cover artist - Ghislain Barbe

ISSN:7447091544

103451.name: The Field Guide to Superheroes Vol. 3
103451.description:
Publisher's Description:

The Field Guide Vol. 3 continues the definitive encyclopedia of superhero archetypes in modern comics.

Written by Jason "Dr. Comics" Tondro, who studied comics for his PhD in Literature, the Field Guide is a gold mine of ideas and inspiration for your next hero. After a discussion of each archetype generally, the Field Guide then gives a fully fleshed out hero, suitable for immediate use as a PC or important NPC in your ICONS campaign.

Rather than break archetypes down by power set, the Field Guide looks at the character's origin and role in the story. This makes the archetypes much more versatile and puts the emphasis on character, rather than power.

103452.name: Might & Magic Heroes VI
videogameexpansion: Might and Magic Heroes VI - Danse Macabre Adventure Pack
Might and Magic Heroes VI - Pirates of the Savage Sea Adventure Pack
Might and Magic Heroes VI: Shades of Darkness
videogamecompilation: Might and Magic Heroes VI Gold Edition
103452.description:
User Summary

Heroes of Might & Magic VI continues the good tradition of the Might & Magic series, as a turn-based strategy game in the wellknown fantasy universe. This time, it involves a mix of familiarity and new innovation, including boss fights, a town conversion functionality, and a new reputation system. There will be five factions in the game: Haven, Inferno, Necropolis, Stronghold and Sanctuary. The former Dungeon faction has been hinted at in the future. Heroes VI is a prequel to the main campaigns of "Heroes of Might and Magic V", and is taking place four centuries earlier in the world of Ashan.

The story:
A legendary Archangel General, killed during the war of the Elder races, is resurrected. Under the cover of preparations for the upcoming Demon invasion, he plots to recover his powers, and take control of Ashan while eradicating his ancient enemies. He underestimates, however, the power of the all-too-human Griffin dynasty!

Heroes VI tells the story of the Griffin dynasty, when they were still Dukes of the Holy Empire, and not yet sitting on the Imperial throne, (like in Heroes 5 and Clash of Heroes).

103453.name: Blade Kitten
103453.description:
User Summary

Blade Kitten is a simple and playful platform game that combines the classic 2D platform game with "beat 'em up" presented in a colorful Japanese manga style. You play the role as Kit Ballard, a young girl with cat-like features, cats ears and tail. She is an Intergalactic Bounty hunter, and one of the very best in the business. Together with her alien sidekick Skiffy and her sword, the Darque Blade, she hunts down rogue mechs and soft targets. Kit becomes the nexus of a tumultuous series of events on the strange planetoid known as HOLLOW WISH.

The game is hardly begun before Kit loses her spaceship, and she gets stolen an important key, which you apparently need. Now, a wild hunt begins, which the local vigilante groups only have little understanding of, and therefore Kit naturally have to fight through hordes of security guards, to come forward.

Fortunately, Kit is very acrobatic and can climb on most surfaces, giving good opportunities to play with the platform genre.
The tracks are naturally linear, but on the way you can find small blind alleys and secret rooms with treasure chests. For money you can upgrade your equipment, and buy different versions of Darque Blade - a "Floating sword" that acts as your weapon. This sword has the typical two different attacks. The brief battle with enemies that are very close, - and a slightly slower beat, with greater range.

Her tale is one of liberation.
Her tail is pink.

103454.description: Drum Roll: Plate Spinner is a promotional card that was offered for free at Spiel 2011 and included with preorders of the Drum Roll base game. The plate spinner belongs to a new performer type called "Oriental"; it is unique and has a new ability.
103454.name: Drum Roll: Plate Spinner

videogame: The Settlers: Heritage of Kings – Gold Edition
103455.name: The Settlers: Heritage of Kings
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamecompilation: The Settlers: Heritage of Kings – Gold Edition
103455.description:
User Summary:

You play as young prince Dario and your goal is to restore your father's great empire that has been torn asunder by evil Mordred, his dark general Kerberos and their minions. It is your courage and resourcefulness along with your companions' unswerving loyalty that will help you throughout your long journey. You must foil evil schemes, face perilous challenges and defeat ferocious barbarians before you can claim the throne and reinstate your empire's former glory.

The fifth installment of this challenging video game somewhat moves players away from economic micromanagement, towards real time strategic warfare, so there is a great emphasis on building a multitude of military units starting early in the game.

103456.name: Bali Adventure
103456.description:
User Summary

Embark for the Bali jungle as you brave the puzzles created by unknown forces in an effort to rescue your friend. Help Super Nanat rescue the Princess from the evil Goddess Vivi Siputko and the devious King Oeloeng.
In this game, you can explore 5 worlds and 19 Levels of endless puzzle action. On your way, you unleash special powers that can aid you in your journey!
Can you solve the puzzles in time to rescue your friend before it's to late?

103457.name: Mike Stewart's Pro Bodyboarding
103457.description:
User Summary

"Mike Stewart's Pro Bodyboarding" is a 3D bodyboarding arcade game with realistic waves, where you can perform real life tricks while surfing. The game is named after Mike Stewart, one of the pioneers of the sport, and winner of nine world championship titles. It features six different modes of play: Contest, Arcade, Slalom, Practice, Training and "Hot-seat" for Two-player.
You can choose between eight different characters - including Stewart himself, to ride the waves, eight different bodyboards, and eight surfing locations from around the world, each with their own unique waves.
When starting a game, the player needs to ride the board inside a wave, rendered in 3D. The boarder can be moved around and perform tricks such as forward spins, reverse spins, air rolls, backflips, double barrel rolls, and much more, for points. There are twelve types of tricks in total. The boarders also need to avoid rocks, buoys, and swimmers in some modes.

103458.name: Crazy Climber 2000
103458.description:
Crazy Climber 2000 is an updated version of the 1980 arcade game Crazy Climber.

In both games the player assumes the role of a daredevil who is attempting to climb to the top of a series of skyscrapers. There are a number of obstacles and dangers to avoid. These include:


Windows that open and close (the most common danger).
Building occupants who throw objects such as flower pots, buckets of water and fruit in an effort to knock the climber off the building.
A giant condor, who drops eggs and excrement aimed at the climber.
A giant ape (in the style of King Kong), whose punch can prove deadly.


If the climber is able to ascend to the top of a skyscraper and grabs the runner of a waiting helicopter, he earns a bonus and is transported to another skyscraper, which presents more dangers than the past.

Crazy Climber 2000 was released for the PlayStation in the year 2000. It is a 3D graphics update of the original arcade game. A notable feature is the ability to turn corners and access different sides of the buildings, which now have a variety of designs (including one with a cylindrical, tower-like shape).

The Crazy Climber 2000 disc includes a port of the original arcade version of Crazy Climber and a scan of the instruction panel. Crazy Climber 2000 was released only in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crazy Climber", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103459.name: Mr. Wimpy: The Hamburger Game
103459.description:
Mr. Wimpy is a platforming video game released by Ocean Software in 1984. The game was intended to be a promotional tie with Wimpy restaurants as their logos, company mascots, and theme tunes were reproduced. The game was released on the Oric 1, ZX Spectrum, BBC Micro and Commodore 64. The gameplay is similar to the video game BurgerTime.

At the start of the game Mr. Wimpy has to cross his kitchen while avoiding moving potholes to get to the larder so that he can collect ingredients and make his burgers. As an added hazard a character called Waldo tries and steal these ingredients from him. After the opening level the game becomes a traditional platform game where the player must guide Mr Wimpy across the platforms whilst walking over four various burger ingredients which in turn causes them to crash to the platform below and finally to the four plates at the bottom.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mr._Wimpy,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.¨

103460.name: POX: Save the People
103460.description:
Pox: Save the People is a new board game challenging 1-4 players to stop the spread of a deadly disease. Not only is the game fun, but through play, players understand group immunity and the need to vaccinate. Players ages 7-65, and both casual and hardcore gamers have enjoyed POX.

Players cooperate to vaccinate and cure people on the board until the disease is fully contained, before the number of deaths exceeds acceptable losses or the disease becomes out of control. The players win or lose together. Players alternate drawing cards. Each card specifies how the disease spreads, and then which public health resources the player has available for allocation. It's important to protect the vulnerable people on the board, because if they become infected, they immediately die. But watch out! Don't neglect the infected people because they can die too if the infection gets too bad!

Many public health groups need to better promote immunizations in order to continue to prevent vaccine preventable diseases. Vaccinations against deadly diseases such as diphtheria, polio, and whooping cough were standard public health measures, and they worked: kids today don’t worry about getting polio, for example. But due to suspicions about vaccines and links to other diseases, more parents are refusing to immunize their children, and this could lead to a national health crisis. Parents mistakenly believe that vaccines aren’t necessary any more, or that children develop immunity to these diseases automatically through time. These myths lead to disaster. Whooping cough is back, for example, for the U.S. has lost what is called herd immunity to this disease as the percent of vaccinated people is lowering, allowing ways for contagion to spread among the populace.

Between POX's unique packaging and gameplay, what's stopping YOU from saving the people?!

103461.description:
Dicey Curves is a dice-driven car racing game, where the track is constructed from a deck of cards. To move around the track, you need to roll dice combinations: straightaways allow you to move for whatever combo you can make, advancing one space per die in the combo, while curves contain gateways that require specific combos of dice – from one to five – in order to pass.

Five-dice combos are tough when you have only five dice to roll, but thanks to "exploding dice" you'll have a chance. In game terms, every 6 you roll allows you to add another die to your roll. To balance the luck sometimes inherent to dice games, players have control chips that allow them to reroll dice, add additional dice, switch positions between cars, and even control other players' cars.

With the track deck, players can construct traditional pre-configured tracks or race along a "mystery rally" route.
103461.name: Dicey Curves

103462.name: Tabu (Issue 4-5, Volume 1 - Jun 1987)
103462.description:
User summary:
Issue 4 got delayed, and in the end FRN merged issue 4-5.

Contains: Gossip, news, Ninjitsu in CoC, reviews, boardgames, CoC adventure, letters and much more.

103463.name: Math'd Potatoes
103463.description:
A math game filled with lots of family fun! Roll your dice trying to hit the required value so you can move ahead. If you fall behind, don't worry. There are several ways to "ketchup"! A great introduction to various math operations.

Players turn over a Math Challenge Card on their turn, and then roll dice to try to get a result that meets the requirements on the card. The Challenges have varied requirements; some require an exact number, and some allow an answer from within a range of numbers, while still others demand an answer that is even or odd.

On their turn, the player rolls dice, some with numbers and some with math operators (+ or -). Players must use all the dice in any order, so long as the number dice are separated by operator dice. If no solution is found, they may reroll some or all of their dice.

On numbered spaces, the Challenge must be solved in a number of attempts less than or equal to the number shown on the space. Some spaces picture a potato and are a "Hot Potato" zone, where any player may win. All players compete at the same time to see who can solve the Challenge first.

When someone wins a Challenge they roll a Number Die, move that many spaces, then take another turn. This continues as long as they are able to solve the Challenge, and passes clockwise when they can't.

When a player passes the Ketchup Packet marker, anyone who is behind gets to slide forward to the closest "Catch Up" space. The first player to reach the final space on the board is the "Sweet Potato" and wins the game.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Problem Solving, Quick Thinking, Less Than, Greater Than, Addition & Subtraction

103464.description:
The Aquarium Expansion provides the cards and rules required to play Aquarium with up to six players for even more fun and interaction.

Aquarium Expansion cannot be played on its own; the base game is required to play.
103464.name: Aquarium Expansion

103465.name: My Monster
103465.description:
Pick your monster and collect all their missing shapes by reaching into the bag. No peeking! An ideal "hands on" activity to encourage tactile skills in young learners.

On their turn, a player draws a Monster Piece from the cloth bag. They can't peek in the bag, but they can spend some time feeling the shapes of the pieces in the bag before selecting one.

If the selected Monster Piece matches an empty space with the same shape and color on their Monster Board, they may fill that space with the Monster Piece. If the space is already occupied by another matching Monster Piece, then they must put the selected marker back into the cloth bag.

When a player has either placed a piece on their Monster Board, or returned a piece to the bag, they pass clockwise. The game ends when one player has filled their Monster Board with the correct Monster Pieces.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Mental Imaging, Probability, Mind/Hand Coordination

103466.description:
Ancient Egyptians hid treasures in their pyramids, and protected them with dangerous traps. Each player picks a pair of colors, and either gains or loses coins based on where those researchers land. Support your team colors and delay the others to win!

Unlike other games, you do not play a single color in Pairamid. Each player always plays in two colors, and these are indicated by Pyramid Markers placed in front of each player. You might share Pyramid colors with another player.

The first player rolls all the dice, and selects one die to place on the board -- the die does not need to match your own color! The player places the die on the matching square on the board, then moves the matching researcher the number of spaces indicated on the die. The player then passes the remaining dice to the next player.

When moving a researcher:

- Spaces occupied by another researcher are jumped over and are not counted.
- If the researcher reaches a space with either the White Scarab or Black Scarab, they stop on that space.

The White Scarab will always be in a white chamber, which will have a positive score listed on the board. When a researcher is moved to a space with the White Scarab, all players with a Pyramid Marker matching the color of the researcher receive the number of Treasure Tokens indicated on the board. Similarly, the Black Scarab will always be in a black chamber, and all players with a Pyramid Marker matching a researcher in a chamber with the Black Scarab will lose the number of Treasure Tokens indicated on the board. In both cases, this causes the Scarab to be moved to the next chamber matching its color (from +1 to +2 to +3 and so on for the White Scarab, and from -1 to -2 to -3 and so on for the Black Scarab).

The Great Chamber may be used as a shortcut by one researcher at a time. It is also the final room for both Scarabs, counting as +7 as well as -7. When a researcher enters the Great Chamber after a Scarab has been placed there, that color is scored as normal (+7 or -7 for the matching color), and the game ends. The player with the most Treasure Tokens wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Working in Teams, Planning Ahead, Evaluating Options
103466.name: Pairamid

103467.description:
This is not a standalone game. It must be played in combination with the base game Sitting Ducks Gallery (Chinese edition) by Wargames Club. The based game combined with this expansion would get a similar result of Sitting Ducks Deluxe (Sitting Ducks Deluxe)

The game comes with 88 game cards. 33 new types of action cards are introduced. 6 new duck colors are added which allow you to expand the game with up to 12 players.

[Chinese, box back]
射鴨子擴展版
在這裡，羽毛仍然到處飛！你試圖把自己的鴨子躲開對手的火藥，還是要考慮射擊對方的鴨子呢？
33種全新行動牌，令你的遊戲有更多的變化，更無盡的樂趣！小鴨牌的出現，使你護幼之心悠然而起！
這擴展更提供6種全新顏色的鴨子牌，遊戲可以同時多逹12人一齊玩了！
103467.name: Sitting Ducks Gallery Expansion

103468.name: Figli dell'Olocausto
103468.description:
user summary

The title means "Sons of the Holocaust".

It's a post-atomic Rpg very military oriented.

The main focus of the game is the post-war Italy of 2028 and the mutants and monsters that now populate the world.
An alien conspiracy that brought to the nuclear self-destruction of man is included.

103469.name: Risk: Metal Gear Solid
103469.description:
User Summary

Risk: Metal Gear Solid adds some twists to the classic game of Risk with a theme based on the Metal Gear Solid video game series.

It takes place on the standard Risk world map, but also includes the territory of Outer Haven which may be moved around the map to attack other territories. Additionally, nuclear strikes on remote territories may be launched by the player who controls Metal Gear Rex.

Players can utilize special units including Solid Snake, the Rat Patrol, Raiden, Liquid Ocelot, Big Momma, and Roy Campbell, each with their own special powers. Players may also collect and play Drebin cards to grant further offensive or defensive powers.

As in traditional Risk, players are attacking other players' territories with their massed troops, attempting to gain control of all of the territories on the map. Players resolve combat with die rolls, with players losing troops to opponents' superior rolls.

Game comes complete with:
Over 290 custom game pieces:
5 PMC Armies
8 Bosses
Outer Haven Battleship
Drebin’s Shop Cards
Territory Cards
PMC Headquarters
Custom Outer Haven Game Board
Custom Earth Game Board
7 dice

Dimensions:
11" x 16" x 3"

Box Weight:
3.40 lbs

103470.name: Tabu (Issue 8, Volume 1 - Nov. 1987)
103470.description:
User summary:
Gossip, news, wounds, damage and hitlocations in CoC, reviews (Traveller: 2300, RuneQuest Monsters), witches in CoC, Real Life Roleplaying, and more

103471.name: Neo Nectaris
103471.description:
User Summary

Neo Nectaris is the sequel and updated edition of Military Madness (Nectaris). The game is military strategy game play hexagonal field.

The game includes
-48 new maps
-old and new units
-five new multiplayer maps

This version was released on TurboGrafx-16 CD so the graphics have slightly improved and the sound is greatly improved. The CD version also includes the Military Madness (Nectaris).

103472.name: Power Eleven
103472.description:
Power Eleven (パワーイレブン) is a football video game with top-down perspective, published by Hudson Soft for the PC Engine, which was released exclusively in Japan in 1991.

There are no fouls or off-sides. In the case of a draw penalty kicks are shot which decide who the winner is. Before the beginning of the 2nd half of each game there is a short cheerleaders show. At the end of the show their leader gives a message to the player.

All players have a number of attributes. These are:

Run (RUN)
Dribble (DBL)
Kick (KCK)
Technique (TEQ)
Power (POW)

Each player has a number for each one which can range from 1 to 10. The higher the number in one attribute the more skilled the player is in that particular area.

The Power attribute refers to the amount of "power" the player begins the game with. During the match this amount is shown in the lower left or right part of the screen for the currently controlled player. When used the player can move faster and strike harder but it also causes the remaining amount to decrease. It is slightly replenished at the beginning of the second half and fully replenished after each match. The total amount of "power" each player can have cannot be changed. Goalkeepers use it automatically when trying to save the ball. The CPU player only ever uses it when shooting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Power Eleven", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103473.name: Tabu (Issue 7, Volume 1 - Sep 1987)
103473.description:
User summary:
Gossip, news, Real life D&D rules, reviews (TMNT), Traveller adventure, witches in roleplaying games, letters and more

103474.name: Psycho Chaser
103474.description:
User Summary

Pyscho Chaser is science fiction shoot 'em up. The story is about robots turning on their masters, humanity. Humanity then creates an even stronger robot to defeat the old robot.

103475.name: Dungeons of Dredmor
videogameexpansion: Dungeons of Dredmor: Conquest of the Wizardlands
Dungeons of Dredmor: Realm of the Diggle Gods
Dungeons of Dredmor: You Have To Name The Expansion Pack
videogamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
103475.description:
The game starts as the player assumes the role of the game's main character entering a hostile dungeon crawler environment. The player enters a dungeon at the top floor and gradually progresses down through levels of increasing difficulty. Each level is a randomly generated maze of interconnected rooms, filled with monsters, traps, loot, and various objects. The game world is laid out in a tile-based square grid viewed from a top-down perspective, where the player, enemies, and various items and objects occupy discrete squares. The game is turn-based, and both the player and numerous enemies take turns performing actions. Each turn the player may move to or attack monsters in adjacent squares, pick up, drop, and use items, and interact with various in-game objects.

As a role-playing game, the player has several character statistics that determine their effectiveness in various aspects of gameplay. The player begins the game with 7 chosen skills, which may be further improved as the player gains experience levels. The combat focuses on melee, ranged, and magic attacks, as well as use of items and skills. Weapons and equipment can be worn to improve player's defences and abilities. The player carries an inventory of items, which can include various foods, drinks, potions, crafting materials, etc.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dungeons of Dredmor", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103477.name: The War of the Wizards
103477.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The reader, as apprentice to the wizard Caladrius, becomes involved in a war of the wizards, during the course of which the reader's choices determine the development of the plot.

103478.name: The Island at the Axis of the World (4E)
103478.description:
From the back cover:

In factories throughout the city of Flint, months of ceasless toil by mages, engineers, and shipbuilders have finally concluded. Now well-wishers from across the nation of Risur have come to witness the launch of the world's mightiest vessel of war: the R.N.S. Coaltongue, impervious to spell and cannon and armed with fire that could slay even a dragon. On the docks, constables keep a close eye on celebrants and troublemakers; in the shadows, conspiracy and betrayal threaten this technological titan on its maiden voyage.

Meanwhile, on an island in the lush Yerasol Achipelago, Risur's traditional enemies unearth ancient ruins while crafting a metal masterpiece of their own. Cloaked in layers of secrecy, their designs creep toward completion, unknown to the outside world. But when a band of rookie constables thwarts the sabotage of the Coaltongue, the traitors responsible flee to that same hidden island, threatening to reveal the dangers that lie at the axis of the world.

The first adventure in the Zeitgeist adventure path takes the heroes from the metropolitan city of Flint to legendary Axis Island on the hunt for a traitor.

A fantasy adventure for venturesome heroes of level 1.

103479.name: The Island at the Axis of the World (Pathfinder)
103479.description:
From the back cover:

In factories throughout the city of Flint, months of ceasless toil by mages, engineers, and shipbuilders have finally concluded. Now well-wishers from across the nation of Risur have come to witness the launch of the world's mightiest vessel of war: the R.N.S. Coaltongue, impervious to spell and cannon and armed with fire that could slay even a dragon. On the docks, constables keep a close eye on celebrants and troublemakers; in the shadows, conspiracy and betrayal threaten this technological titan on its maiden voyage.

Meanwhile, on an island in the lush Yerasol Achipelago, Risur's traditional enemies unearth ancient ruins while crafting a metal masterpiece of their own. Cloaked in layers of secrecy, their designs creep toward completion, unknown to the outside world. But when a band of rookie constables thwarts the sabotage of the Coaltongue, the traitors responsible flee to that same hidden island, threatening to reveal the dangers that lie at the axis of the world.

The first adventure in the Zeitgeist adventure path takes the heroes from the metropolitan city of Flint to legendary Axis Island on the hunt for a traitor.

A fantasy adventure for venturesome heroes of level 1.

103480.name: The Magician's Ring
103480.description:
Publisher Blurb:

An evil magician has cast a spell, turning everyone into an animal. Suddenly a strange horse nuzzles your shoulder. An old woman offers to tell you what she knows. How will you save the kingdom? If you want to: search for the magician, turn to page 22; ride away on the horse, turn to page 36; go to the woman's cottage, turn to page 53. Make the wrong decisions, and you may lose your life. Make the right decisions, and you could be a hero. Whatever fate you meet, you can always go back and start again. In the Forgotten Forest, only one thing is certain: The choice is yours.

103481.name: The Master of Mazes
103481.description:
Publisher Blurb:

As a dweller in the Forgotten Forest, the reader makes decisions determining the course of the story after his pet beast becomes trapped in the manor house of the Master of Mazes.

103482.name: The Forbidden Towers
103482.description:
Publisher Blurb:

As Lifin, a young elf, the reader makes decisions controlling his search through the five Forbidden Towers for the herb that will cure his people of the elven plague.

103483.name: Grim & Gritty
103483.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tough Justice takes you back to the courtrooms of the Georgian era and The Bloody Code when even the most petty of crimes could see you dancing the Tyburn jig.

The stakes don't get any higher - life and death.

Grim & Gritty provides rules for more conventional combat and duelling with risk in Tough Justice.

103484.name: Mystery at the Ball Game
103484.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The reader, overhearing a conversation about a plot to kidnap a millionaire's son at a Little League game, makes decisions which determine the outcome of the story

103485.name: The Missing Rock Star Caper
103485.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The reader follows clues and directs the course of the investigation into the mysterious disappearance of a famous rock star.

103486.name: The Marathon Race Mystery
103486.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The reader, a school reporter and amateur detective, overhears a suspicious conversation in a sporting goods store that may affect an upcoming marathon. A course of action must be decided on right away.

103487.name: Mystery at the Bike Race
103487.description:
Publisher Blurb:

As you, the reader, work on a newspaper story about your town's annual bicycle race, your suspicions are aroused that something sinister is happening involving the new electronics plant.

103488.name: Super NES Mouse
103488.description:
The Super NES Mouse is a peripheral released by Nintendo in 1992 for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES). Originally designed for use with the game Mario Paint, the SNES Mouse was sold in a bundle with the game and included a plastic mouse pad. Soon after its introduction, several other titles were released with Super NES Mouse support.

Although this device closely resembles and mimics the functionality of a two-button computer mouse, it was smaller than most computer mice of the time and had a significantly shorter cord than the standard Super NES controller.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super NES Mouse", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103490.name: The Case of the Mummy's Tomb
103490.description:
Publisher Blurb

Blackstone and two amateur detectives, Amanda and Alex Roberts, must investigate the construction site of what will be the world's tallest building, where supernatural events have supposedly been occurring. The investigation leads to all sorts of strange events involving Egypt, rock stars, alchemy and, of course, magicians.

103491.name: The Case of the Gentleman Ghost
103491.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cal and Rita, two of Blackstone's assistants, try to catch a jewel thief called Gentleman Jack who has returned after forty years to the Falcon Cliff Lodge, once a favorite vacation spot for movie stars.

103492.name: The Case of the Phantom Treasure
103492.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dennison has teamed a pair of young sleuths with none other than magician extraordinaire Harry Blackstone, Jr., in a "What-Do-I-Do-Now?" series. All three not only contain mystery galore but magic tricks as well. A new twist to a tired genre. Librarians won't need a magician to get these paperbacks to vanish from the racks.

103494.name: America's Secret King
103494.description:
User Summary:

Two children stumble upon a mysterious secret object, the crown of George Washington!

103495.name: The Secrets of Stonehenge
103495.description:
User Summary:

Follow Tom and Alice Kinglsey to the mysterious ruins of Stonehenge and the even more mysterious Blackstone!

103496.name: Super Fire ProWrestling
103496.description:
User Summary

The first game in the long running Fire Pro Wrestling video game series to be released for the Super Famicom.

This volume features wrestlers from New Japan ProWrestling, All Japan ProWrestling, Super World Sports, Universal Wrestling Federation, World Wrestling Federation, and Japanese Wrestling Alliance.

103497.name: Pro Wrestling
103497.description:
User Summary

Pro Wrestling is the first wrestling game for the Game Boy released by Human Entertainment.

The game contains few modes of play, and has a roster of eight wrestlers plus one hidden boss, each with their own move set. The game contains the trademark wrestling experience that only Human Entertainment can provide.

103498.name: Nintendo 64 Jumper Pak
103498.description:
The Jumper Pak (ターミネータ パック Tāminēta Pakku, Terminator Pack) is a filler that plugged into the console's memory expansion port. It serves no functional purpose other than to terminate the RAMBUS bus in the absence of the Expansion Pak. This is functionally equivalent to a continuity RIMM in a RAMBUS motherboard filling the unused RIMM sockets until the user upgrades. Early Nintendo 64 consoles (prior to the Expansion Pak's release) came with the Jumper Pak included and already installed. Jumper Paks were not sold individually in stores and could only be ordered individually through Nintendo's online store. The system requires the jumper pak when the expansion pak is not present or else there will be no picture on the TV screen.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nintendo 64 accessories", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103499.name: Bomberman: Panic Bomber
103499.description:
Bomberman: Panic Bomber (ボンバーマン ぱにっくボンバー) is a 1994 puzzle video game developed and published by Hudson Soft for the TurboGrafx-CD on December 22, 1994.

It is a "falling blocks" puzzle game based on the Bomberman franchise. The goal of the game is essentially to cause your opponent to lose by causing their gameplay field to fill to the top with objects. You do this by causing chains of bombs to explode, sending useless rubble over to your opponent's field, which they must then remove themselves. Bombs are earned by causing chains of three identical blocks to disappear. Bombs can only be blown up with an explosion from a lit bomb, which falls from the top of the screen every so often. If the player causes enough damage, they can eventually earn a giant bomb, which will remove a large amount of debris from the playing field, and cause their opponent a good deal of trouble.

The game's regular story mode revolves around Bomberman's hunt for the Golden Bomber statue. During his trek, he fights against several different odd characters, like Drifty the balloon, or Cecil the tiger. However, all that can really be earned from playing through this mode is a harder difficulty level, earned by finishing the entire story at the "hard" difficulty level. The player's progress is saved by a password system.

Panic Bomber was ported to the Neo Geo, Virtual Boy (known in Japan as Tobidase! Panibon (とびだせ！ぱにボン?) and known in North America simply as Panic Bomber), Super Famicom (known in Japan as Super Bomberman: Panic Bomber W (スーパーボンバーマン ぱにっくボンバーW)), and PlayStation Portable. It was also included in the Nintendo GameCube and PlayStation 2 versions of Bomberman Land 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bomberman: Panic Bomber", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

103500.name: Fire ProWrestling Z
103500.description:
User Summary

Fire ProWrestling Z was the first game in the long running Fire Pro Wrestling series to be released for the PlayStation 2.

This installment of the game builds upon the previously released Fire ProWrestling D, and adds more options for the Edit and Match modes. There is also a new Story Mode that allows you to play the role of 4 wrestlers.

The game retains the timing based grappling system and 2D graphics of the previous incarnations.
